summary: Dr. Ernesto Torres was convicted of fourth-degree sex offense and second-degree assault involving a vulnerable 18-year-old patient during an examination, despite being acquitted of second-degree rape. The Maryland State Board of Physicians' Disciplinary Panel B determined these convictions were crimes involving moral turpitude. As a result, Dr. Torres's medical license was suspended, as mandated by state law, pending the outcome of his criminal appeal.
